#Text=THE LETTER IN THE CHAPS
#Text=Though hours may drag themselves into the past so sluggishly that one is fairly maddened by the snail 's pace of them , into the past they must go eventually .
#Text=Jean had sat and listened to the wheels of the Golden State Limited clank over the cryptic phrase that meant so much .
#Text=" Letter-in-the-chaps !

column1: #Text=until Jean thought she would go crazy if they kept it up much longer .
#Text=Little by little they drew near to Los Angeles .
#Text=And then they were there , sliding slowly through the yards in a drab drizzle of one of California 's fall rains .
#Text=Then they were in a taxicab , making for the Third Street tunnel .
#Text=Then Jean stared heavy-eyed at the dripping palms along the boulevard which led away from the smoke of the city and into Hollywood , snuggled against the misty hills .
#Text=" Letter-in-the-chaps ! " her tired brain repeated it still .
#Text=Then she was in the apartment shared with Muriel Gay and her mother .
#Text=These two were over at the studio , the landlady told her when she let them in , and Jean was glad that they were gone .
#Text=She knelt , still in her hat and coat and with her gloves on , and fitted her trunk key into the lock .
#Text=And there she stopped .
#Text=What if the letter were not in the chaps , after all ?
#Text=What if it were but a trivial note , concerning a matter long since forgotten ; a trivial note that had not the remotest bearing upon the murder ?
#Text=" Letter-in-the-chaps ! " The phrase returned with a mocking note and beat insistently through her brain .
#Text=She sat back on the floor and shivered with the chill of a fireless room in California , when a fall rain is at its drizzling worst .
#Text=In the next room one of the men coughed ; afterwards she heard Lite 's voice , saying something in an undertone to Art Osgood .
#Text=She heard Art 's voice mutter a reply .
#Text=She raised herself again to her knees , turned the key in the lock , and lifted the trunk-lid with an air of determination .
#Text=Down next the bottom of her big trunk they lay , just as she had packed them away , with her dad 's six-shooter and belt carefully disposed between the leathern folds .
#Text=She groped with her hands under a couple of riding-skirts and her high , laced boots , got a firm grip on the fringed leather , and dragged them out .
#Text=She had forgotten all about the gun and belt until they fell with a thump on the floor .
#Text=She pulled out the belt , left the gun lying there by the trunk , and hurried out with the chaps dangling over her arm .
#Text=She was pale when she stood before the two who sat there waiting with their hats in their hands and their faces full of repressed eagerness .
#Text=Her fingers trembled while she pulled at the stiff , leather flap of the pocket , to free it from the button .
#Text=" Maybe it ai n't there yet , " Art hazarded nervously , while they watched her .
#Text="
#Text=" That 's the one , all right . "
#Text=Jean sat down suddenly because her knees seemed to bend under her weight .
#Text=Three years -- and that letter within her reach all the time !
#Text=" Let 's see , Jean . "
#Text=Lite reached out and took it from her nerveless fingers .
#Text=" Maybe it wo n't amount to anything at all . "
#Text=Jean tried to hold herself calm .
#Text=" Read it -- out loud , " she said .
#Text=" Then we 'll know . "
#Text=She tried to smile , and made so great a failure of it that she came very near crying .
#Text=The faint crackle of the cheap paper when Lite unfolded the letter made her start nervously .
#Text=" Read it -- no matter -- what it is , " she repeated , when she saw Lite 's eyes go rapidly over the lines .
#Text=Lite glanced at her sharply , then leaned and took her hand and held it close .
#Text=His firm clasp steadied her more than any words could have done .
#Text=Without further delay or attempt to palliate its grim significance , he read the note :
#Text=Aleck :
#Text=If Johnny Croft comes to you with anything about me , kick him off the ranch .
#Text=He claims he knows a whole lot about me branding too many calves .
#Text=Do n't believe anything he tells you .
#Text=He 's just trying to make trouble because he claims I underpaid him .
#Text=He was telling Art a lot of stuff that he claimed he could prove on me , but it 's all a lie .
#Text=Send him to me if he comes looking for trouble .
#Text=I 'll give him all he wants .
#Text=Art found a heifer down in the breaks that looks like she might have blackleg .
#Text=I 'm going down there to see about it .
#Text=Maybe you better ride over and see what you think about it ; we do n't want to let anything like that get a start on us .
